WELCOME: Welcome to your PANEDA headend system
SUBCHANNEL_ID_NOT_ALLOWED: Subchannel ID {{usedSubchannelId}} is not allowed according to contract.
SERVICE_ID_NOT_ALLOWED: Service ID {{usedServiceId}} is not allowed according to contract.
ENTER_VALID_EMAIL: Please enter a valid email address
INVALID_CREDENTIALS: Invalid username and/or password. Try again.
H_SPI_BUCKET_DELETE_CONTENT: Delete all the services and content you created in this SPI bucket. This action cannot be undone.
ACTIVATE_CONFIG_ASAP: Activate configuration as soon as possible
CONFIG_SYNTAX_ERROR: Invalid configuration syntax. Try fixing the problem in the expert editor.
INVALID_PTY_FOUND: Invalid PTY selected. No FIG 0/17 will be generated.
INVALID_LANGUAGE_FOUND: Invalid language selected. No FIG 0/5 will be generated.
CAPACITY_OVERBOOKED: Capacity overbooked. Used: {{usedCu}} CU. Allowed capacity: {{cuCapacity}} CU.
NO_CONFIG_SELECTED: No configuration selected. Please select or create a configuration to edit.
BLANK_USES_DEFAULT: Leaving this field blank will use the server default value
H_LONG_SERVICE_LABEL: The service label, or programme service label, consists of a maximum of 16 characters. It is transmitted in FIG 1/1
H_SHORT_SERVICE_LABEL: The short service label consist of 8 selectable characters from the long label and is used by devices with a limited sceen size. Toggle the selection of a character by clicking the corresponding button.
H_SUBCHANNEL_ID: The identifier of the channel in the ensemble that carries the data for this service.
H_SUBCHANNEL_ONLY: When checked FIG(s) are only generated for the subchannel. No service Figs are created
H_BITRATE: The bitrate for this service before any EEP/UEP error correction is applied.
H_SBR: Spectral band replication. Improves percieved sound quality for low to medium bitrates.
H_AUDIO_MODE_AAC: Requested audio mode. Parametric stereo improves percieved sound quality for low bitrates. Requires SBR.
H_AUDIO_MODE_MP2: Requested audio mode. Joint stereo improves percieved sound quality for low bitrates.
H_PROTECTION_TYPE: Equal error protection (EEP) must be used for DAB+ and data services but can be used for DAB services too. Unequal error protection (UEP) is recommended for DAB services and cannot be used for DAB+ or data services.
H_EEP_LEVEL: Level 1-4A can be used with all bitrates. level 1-4B only with multiples of 32kbit/s. The net bitrate after error protection is applied is shown to the right. Not sure? Pick 3A!
H_UEP_LEVEL: UEP can only be used with mpeg 1/2 layer II audio data. The net bitrate after error protection is applied is shown to the right. Not all combinations are valid
H_PAD_RATE: The bitrate of the programme associative data (PAD). Remember the effective audio bitrate is decreased with the PAD allocation. 0 = disable PAD
H_AAC_SAMPLE_FREQ: The output sampling frequency of the encoder. Note. if SRB is enabled the core sampling frequency is 16 or 24 kHz instead of 32 or 48 kHz.
H_MP2_SAMPLE_FREQ: The sampling frequency of the encoder. 24 or 48 kHz.
H_AUTO_GEN_FIG013: If slideshow is included in PAD FIG 0/13 must indicate this in order to enable the receivers to decode the images. Tick the switch to get an auto generated fig 0/13.
H_LANGUAGE: The language of the program (FIG 0/5). Set to Unknown if not specified. Available languages according to ETSI TS 101 756 V1.6.1.
H_PTY: The content type of the program (Fig 0/17). Set to no programme type if not specified. Available programme types according to ETSI TS 101 756 V1.6.1.
H_GEN_STATIC_PTY: Program type can either be static, dynamic or both. A static program type should indicate the overall content for the service, for example pop music. Dynamic PTYs can be used to update this as the content changes over a day. For example during the news.
H_AUDIO_SOURCE: The source of the audio. One source can be used in several services if desired.
H_PAD_SOURCE: The source of the PAD data. One source can be used in several services if desired.
PASSWORD_LENGTH: The password must be between 6-100 characters.
FAILED_UPDATE_VIRTUAL_PROVIDER_FOR: Failed to update virtual provider for
SHOULD_SEND_SEPARATELY: Should be sent separately if the system is accessible from the internet
SCAN_THE_BARCODE: Scan the QR code with your two factor authentication app
ENTER_ONE_TIME_TOKEN: Enter the code from your two factor authentication app
TWO_FACTOR_DISABLE_FAILED: Unable to disable two factor authentication
H_IN_SUBCHANNEL_ID: The subchannel ID in the ETI stream to extract.
H_IN_STREAM_ID: The stream ID (stid) in the STI stream to extract.
H_LINKED_SUBCHANNEL_ID: The subchannel ID you want to link this service too. The subchannel must exist in the configuration.
H_ETI_SOURCE: The source representing the ETI stream you want to extract a subchannel from. In addition a static converter from for example EDI is needed.
H_STI_SOURCE: The source representing the STI stream you want to extract a stream from. In addition a static converter from for example FEP is needed.
H_COUNTRY_ID_OVERRIDE: The countryID and ECC has been overridden for this service to {{countryIdOverride}} and {{eccOverride}} respectively
H_ACTIVE: Toggle between active and passive system. Only one system should be active at a time.
NO_CLUSTER_CONFIGURED: No cluster configured. Contact Paneda to set up redundancy!
LEVEL_MONITOR_NOT_SUPPORTED: Monitor not supported for this input
TITLE: Title
MUST_BE_GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO: Must be greater than or equal to
MUST_BE_LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO: Must be less than or equal to
NO_CURRENT_CONFIG: The selected provider has no active configuration
NAME: Name
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_ALL: Includes every alarm source in the system.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_AUDIO_ENCODER: Indicates that the audio encoder is producing data (aac/mp2).
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_AUDIO_INPUT: Indicates that the audio input is producing raw audio samples.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_AUDIO_SILENCE: Indicates that the audio is not silent.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_INPUT_BUFFER: Indicates that the multiplexer receives data for the subchannel.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_INPUT_BUFFER_ENCODER: Indicates that the multiplexer receives data from the encoder.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_PREFERRED_SUBCH_INPUT_: Indicates that the multiplexer is using the preferred input for the subchannel
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_REDUNDANCY_SELECTOR: Indicates that the subchannel can use all redundant inputs without restrictions
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_ENCODER_LAUNCER: Indicates that the encoder launcher in the encoder pool is working.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_PAD: Indicates that PAD data is produced for the service.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_PAD_FRESHNESS: Indicates that PAD data has been updated within the specified time period.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_PAD_DLS_OVERRIDE_FRESH: Indicates that the override data for DLS has been updated within the specified timeout period.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_PAD_SLS_OVERRIDE_FRESH: Indicates that the override data for SLS has been updated within the specified timeout period.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_OVERRIDE_FRESHNESS: Indicates that the override data for the application has been updated within the specified timeout period.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_PAD_DLS_ENCODER: Indicates that the DLS encoder is producing data.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_PAD_SLS_ENCODER: Indicates that the SLS encoder is producing data.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_TRANSPORT: Indicates that data is correctly received over the selected transport and wireformat.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_ENCAPSULATED_PROTOCOL: Indicates that the received data has the correct protocol and that the requested data stream is found.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_EXTRACTED_CONTENT: Indicates that the extracted data stream contains valid content of the expected type
H_CPU_LOAD: Indicated the CPU load of the unit.
H_OS_FREE_MEM: Indicates that enough RAM memory is available.
H_PANEDA_APP_FREE_MEM: Indicates that the memory allocation in Paneda applications is OK.
H_SYSTEM_DISK_SPACE: Indicates that enough free disk space is available in the system.
H_LICENSE_STATE: Indicates that a valid license is installed.
H_NTP_SYNC: Indicates that the system clock is synchronized via NTP.
H_APP_SYNC: Indicates that the internal time is synchronized to the system clock.
H_APP_RUNNING: Indicates that all Paneda applications/services are running
H_CLUSTER_HEALTH: Indicates that all peers in the redundancy cluster is reachable.
H_CLUSTER_CONFIG: Indicates that all reachable peers in the redundancy cluster is running the same service configuration.
H_LAST_ACTIVATED_CONFIG: Indicates that the last activated configuration was OK.
H_SCHEDULER_RUNNING: Indicates that the scheduler is monitoring the schedule.
H_SCHEDULER_CONFLICT: Indicates if there are any conflicts between scheduled reconfigurations.
DRAG_AND_DROP_IMAGE_HERE_OR_PRESS_TO_SEL: Drag and drop image here or press to select.
DISABLED_DETAIL_BUTTON: Details are not available for successfull logins/logouts
IMAGE_UNEXPECTED_FILE_ERROR: Unexpected error. The uploaded file could not be read.
IMAGE_FORMAT_VALIDATION_ERROR: The uploaded file is not in the correct format. Expected {{expected}} and found {{found}}
IMAGE_DIMENSION_VALIDATION_ERROR: The image must have the dimension '{{width}}x{{height}}'. Found '{{naturalWidth}}x{{naturalHeight}}'
LANGUAGE_CODE_PATTERN: Must follow the correct format. E.g. 'en', 'en-GB', 'sr-Latn-RS', etc.
H_LANGUAGE_CODE: Specifies the language with optional subtags, for example 'en' or 'en-GB'. For more information about the available codes and formats, see RFC 3066 (BCP 47) and ISO 639.
H_SPI_CONTENT_TAB_LOGO_HINT: Note: In order to distinguish services either the 32x32 or 112x32 logo will be displayed in the service tab
H_API_TOKEN_NEVER_SHOWN_AGAIN: Copy your token now. It will never be shown again.
H_API_TOKEN_USAGE: Use your token in the Authorization header with type Bearer.
SELECT_AUTO_TO_ADJUST_TIMEZONE: Select auto as local time offset in ensemble configuration to select your time zone.
DRAG_DROP_OR_PASTE_IMAGES_HERE: Drag and drop or paste images here to upload
DRAG_DROP_OR_PASTE_AUDIO_HERE: Drag and drop or paste audio file here to upload
DRAG_AND_DROP_IMAGES_NOT_SUPPORTED: Drag and drop images not supported. Please use a modern browser
PAD_SOURCE_NOT_EDITABLE: The selected PAD source cannot be edited
INVALID_STRING_EXT: Invalid string. Allowed characters: '{{allowedChars}}'. Starting with: '{{startChars}}'
INVALID_RANGE: Invalid range. Each value must follow the range [{{min}} .. {{max}}]
INVALID_UNICAST: Invalid: Address not in the unicast range
INVALID_MULTICAST_ADDRESS: Invalid multicast address: range should be 224.0.0.0 - 239.255.255.255
H_ENABLE_SSM: Click to add one or more (max 10) source IP addresses for SSM filtering.
H_VOLUME: Output volume in percent of input. 100% = no change. Use with great care as clipping may occur.
H_SIGNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_SUPPORT: Check this box to signal announcement support for the service. (FIG 0/18)
H_ANNOUNCEMENT_CLUSTER: The announcement cluster(s) or group(s) that can interrupt this service
H_ANNOUNCEMENT_TYPE: The type(s) of announcements that can interrupt this service. The alarm type is always activated.
NEW_VERSION_RELOAD_NEEDED: A new GUI version has been installed. Please reload the browser to use it.
INSUFFICIENT_LICENSE_BOOL: Insufficient license. Action require license for: {{name}}
INSUFFICIENT_LICENSE_NUM: Insufficient license. Action require license for: {{name}} with more than {{number}} instances
INSUFFICIENT_OWNERSHIP: This function is registered to the provider: '{{provider}}'. Your user does not belong to that provider.
ACTION_REQUIRE_PROVIDER: Action requires your user to belong to the provider: '{{provider}}'
ACTION_REQUIRE_LICENSE_NUM: Action require license for: {{name}} with more than {{number}} instances
CANDIDATE_HAS_DIFFERENT_VERSION: Cluster member has a different version. Synchronisation is degraded.
CANDIDATE_HAS_DIFFERENT_UPGRADE_ACTIONS: Cluster member has a different upgrade actions remaining. Synchronisation is degraded.
SYSTEM_IS_PASSIVE: System is passive. Action requires an active system
H_SILENCE_DETECT_TIME_SPAN: The minimum time the audio level must be below the threshold in order to trigger the silece alarm.
H_SILENCE_DETECT_THRESHOLD: The maximum level allowed of the incoming audio in order to trigger the silence alarm.
H_COMPENSATE_FOR_DRIFT: If the input audio is not syncronized to the correct clock, periodic glitches will occur. When checked, the drift is compensated for using a high quality resampler. This ensures a continuous stream without glitches.
NO_AUDIO_SERVICES_FOUND_IN_CONFIGURATION: No audio services found in configuration
NO_DATA_SERVICES_FOUND_IN_CONFIGURATION: No data services found in configuration
NO_MSC_ITEMS_FOUND_IN_MSC_LAYOUT: No MSC items found in the MSC layout
NO_FAILED_MSC_ITEMS_FOUND_IN_MSC_LAYOUT: No failed MSC items found in the MSC layout
H_HIDE_OK_STATES: Toggle between hiding all ok states or not.
HIDE_FAILED_DEPEND_ON: Hide failed states that depend on a failed state
H_HIDE_FAILED_DEPEND_ON: Toggle between hiding or displaying failed states that depend on another failed state. For example audio-level will depend on audio-input.
H_NO_FAILED_STATES_FOUND_FOR_CATEGORY: No failed states for the category exist.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_DATA_INPUT: Indicates that raw data is received at the input source.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_DATA_GROUP_ENCODER: Indicates that the data group encoder is producing data groups.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_PMD_APPLICATION_ENCODE: Indicates that the application encoder is producing data.
H_STATUS_HAS_EPG_DATA: Indicates that ready to transmit EPG data exist
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_SUBCHANNEL_CAPACITY: Indicates that all received data fit into the subchannel
H_DATA_SOURCE: The source of the data. One source can be used in several services if desired.
H_EPG_SOURCE: The input source for the EPG data. If rest-api is selected no more configuration is needed. Contact Paneda for API description.
H_DATA_TYPE: The type of data sent. See Data Service Component Type (DSCTy) in ETSI TS 101 756 (Registered Tables)
H_USER_APPLICATION: The user application type of the data. See User Application type (UAtype) in ETSI TS 101 756 (Registered Tables)
H_PACKET_ADDRESS: The address of the packets carrying the data in the subchannel.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_ETI_INPUT: Indicates that valid ETI data is received.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_SUBCHANNEL_DATA: Indicates that the selected subchannel is found in the ETI data.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_STI_STREAM: Indicates that an individual STI stream with matching stream ID is being received.
FW_IS_ACTIVE: The firewall is active and filtering traffic.
FW_IS_INACTIVE: Warning: The firewall is inactive. All traffic is allowed.
FIREWALL_RULE_DELETED: Firewall rule deleted. Remember to commit the change.
FIREWALL_ENABLED: Firewall enabled. Remember to commit the change.
H_COMMIT_FIREWALL_SETTINGS: The firewall has been activated / more restricted. Please verify access and then commit the changes.
H_AUTOMATIC_DEACTIVATION: The firewall will automatically deactivate in {{timeLeft}} seconds to prevent you from locking yourself out.
BITRATE_MULTIPLE_32: Bitrate must be a multiple of 32 when EEP level B is used
USE_SWITCH_PATCHING: If possible. Patch output from all available inputs
USE_SF_SWITCHING: If possible. Do the switchover on a superframe boundary
SWITCH_INPUT_CONSTRAINT: Exactly one switch input must use 127.0.0.1 as host
PREFER_ASC: Prefer mux by name, in ascending order
PREFER_DESC: Prefer mux by name, in descending order
SUCCESS_UPDATE_ETI_IN_SETTINGS: Successfully updated ETI input settings settings
FAIILED_UPDATE_ETI_IN_SETTINGS: Failed to update ETI input settings
NO_SWITCH_INSTALLED: No switch installed. Contact Paneda to set up redundancy!
H_UPSTREAM_CONNECTION: Indicates that the network connection to the upstream is working.
H_ETI_INPUT_DATA_COARSE_QUALITY: Indicates that the incoming ETI data is syntactically ok.
H_OUTPUT_ENDPOINT: Indicates that the sending of data to the endoint is successful.
H_ETI_INPUT_DATA_FINE_QUALITY: Indicates that the incoming ETI stream, including all subchannels, contains OK data.
H_SWITCH_OUTPUT: Indicates that the output from the switch, including all subchannels, contains error free (but not necessarily preferred) data.
H_EQUIVALENT_DATA_FOUND: Indicates that two or more streams carrying equivalent data is found. This enables seamless switchover.
H_PREFERRED_SELECTED: Indicates that all subchannels contain the preferred data
H_DEVICE_CONNECTION: Indicates that the device is connected to the server.
UNSUPPORTED_BROWSER: Your browser is not supported. Use Google Chrome for the best user experience.
PETI_FEC_HELP_2: When level B us used, columns must be at least 4
NO_PETI_INSTALLED: No FEP output installed. Contact Paneda to install module.
NO_EDI_INSTALLED: No EDI output installed. Contact Paneda to install module.
BACKUP_AUDIO_FILE_INPUT_SOURCE_MISSING: Selected backup audio file source '{{sourceName}}' is missing
NO_LAUNCH_AT_SPECIFIED: Selected input source '{{sourceName}}' does not specify an encoder to launch at
SUBCHANNEL_CU_START: Start CU address (leave blank for automatic mode)
H_USE_CAPACITY_START: Start CU of the range allocated for this provider
CAPACITY_START_RULE: Manual capacity start must be set on either all or no virtual providers
CU_OVERALLOCATED: Capacity overallocated. Remove {{cu}} CU from contract
PROVIDER_ID_DUPLICATES: The following provider IDs are duplicated: {{dupes}}
PROGRAM_SERVICE_REF_DUPLICATES: The following programme service references are duplicated: {{dupes}}
DATA_SERVICE_REF_DUPLICATES: The following data service references are duplicated: {{dupes}}
LINK_SET_NUMBER_DUPLICATES: The following linkage set numbers are duplicated: {{dupes}}
LSN_DUPLICATES: The following linkage set numbers are duplicated: {{dupes}}
DUPLICATED_FIG_KEY_DATA: The following data is duplicated which would result in the same DAB FIG key - : {{duplicatedData}}
H_ALARM_FLAG: Control the AL-flag bit in FIG 0/0. See ETSI 300 401 for details.
AL_FLAG_SET_IN_ENSEMBLE: Alarm support is specified on ensemble level
FIG_O7_RECOMMENDED: Note: It is recommended to use the FIG 0/7.
H_FIG_O7_ENABLED: Control the usage of FIG 0/7 (I.e. if ETSI 300 401 v2.1+ is enabled or not).
SERVICE_CONF_REFORMAT: Convert service configuration format: '{{reason}}'. - Click to convert.
SETTING_MOVE: Setting has moved: '{{reason}}'. - Click to convert.
SETTING_REFORMAT: Setting format has changed: {{reason}}'. - Click to convert.
COUNTRY_ID_MISMATCH_IN_ENSEMBLE_ID: The ensemble ID has inconsistent country ID. Found: {{foundId}}. Expected: {{expectedId}}.
H_LONG_LABEL: The label consists of a maximum of 16 bytes.
H_SHORT_LABEL: The short label consists of a subset of the long label. Maximum 8 characters.
INVALID_COUNTRY_CODES: The combination of country code, ecc and itu code seem invalid.
LABEL_TOO_LONG: The label "{{label}}" requires {{bytes}} bytes to be encoded in {{encoding}}. 16 bytes are max.
RECONFIGURATION_NEEDED_FOR_ALL_PROVIDERS: A reconfiguration is needed for all providers
H_RECONFIGURATION_NEEDED: The current configuration on air may not reflect the latest changes that has been performed
H_REMOVE_SNMP_SETTINGS: Remove all settings and disable the SNMP agent
SNMP_SETTINGS_REMOVED: SNMP settings removed and SNMP agent disabled
TWO_FACTOR_MUST_BE_ENABLED_FOR_THIS_FEAT: Two factor authentication must be enabled to use this feature
FORM_INVALID: The form is invalid. Please fill out all fields according to the instructions.
USER_NOT_AUTH_FOR_PROXY: Your user is not authorized to use the selected proxy connection
CLOSE_MY_SESSIONS: Close my sessions (You have {{numActiveSessions}} active session(s) )
CLOSE_ALL_SESSIONS: Close all sessions (Other users have {{numActiveSessions}} active session(s) )
PBS_WELCOME: Welcome to your PANEDA break-in system
H_PBS_STATUS_RF_INPUT: Indicates the presence of external DAB signal
H_PBS_STATUS_TF_ALIGNMENT: Indicates that the external and local transmission frames are aligned
H_PBS_STATUS_CLOCK_SYNC: Indicates that the external and local time domains are synchronized
H_PBS_STATUS_AUDIO_IN: Indicates that the line-in is working
H_PBS_STATUS_AUDIO_OUT: Indicates that the line-out is working
H_PBS_STATUS_SIGNAL_CTRL: Indicates the presence of a break-in state signal
H_PBS_STATUS_DRNS: Indicates the presence of the hardware RF-switch
H_PBS_STATUS_LOCAL_RF: Indicates the presence of the local RF signal at the RF-switch
H_PBS_STATUS_MUX_CONF: Indicates that the multiplexer has mirrored the on-air configuration
H_PBS_STATUS_MUX_INPUT: Indicates that the multiplexer has input on all its subchannels
H_PBS_STATUS_CIF_SYNC: Indicates that the multiplexer is synchronized to the on-air CIF count
H_PVP_STATUS_TRIGGER: Indicates that the local trigger input is available
H_PVP_STATUS_INPUT: Indicates that local audio input is detected
SUCCESS_UPDATE_PVP_VOLUME: Successfully updated PVP volume. The hardware adjusted the value to: {{volume}} %
FAILED_UPDATE_PVP_VOLUME: Failed to update the PVP volume
SUCCESS_TURNED_ON_ID_LED: Successfully turned on the ID LED
SUCCESS_TURNED_OFF_ID_LED: Successfully turned off the ID LED
FAILED_TO_CHANGE_THE_ID_LED: Failed to change the state of the ID_LED
FAILED_UPDATE_PVP: Failed to update the PVP settings
H_LOCAL_PVP_STATUS_AUDIO_IN: Indicates that local audio input is detected
H_LOCAL_PVP_STATUS_TRIGGER: Indicates that the local trigger input is available
MINIMUM_STABLE_TIME_BEFORE_TRAP_CLEAR: The minimum time that must pass before an error trap is cleared
H_HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL_SECONDS: A heartbeat trap will be sent to all trap hosts with selected interval. Set to 0 to disable.
H_ENABLE_MAX_AGE: When enabled a alarm will be set if the uploaded PAD data is too old. And optionally the (old) PAD can be stopped from being broadcasted
H_INCLUDE_DYNAMIC_LABEL: Use a dynamic label service (DLS). A DLS service can only be carried in PAD.
H_INCLUDE_USER_APPLICATION: Use a user application service. These services can often be sent in both PAD or using a PMD subchannel.
H_MIN_DISPLAY_DURATION_SECONDS: The minimum time this object should appear on the receiver. Required for DLS. Optional for SLS (the image will then appear for how long it takes to transmit the next one)
DL_PLUS_API_ONLY: DL+ tags. Use the API to modify the DL+ content.
FAILED_TO_UPDATE_DATA_SOURCE_CONTENT: Failed to update data source content
FAILED_TO_DELETE_DATA_SOURCE_CONTENT: Failed to delete data source content
NO_APPLICATION_DEFINED: No application defined on the data source. Define an application on the settings tab before viewing/updating the content.
H_ALLOW_ABORT_CURRENT_OBJECT: Allow abort of the currently transmitted object. If yes, then the new object will be broadcasted as soon as possible. If no, then the current object will be allowed to finish first.
H_TARGET_DISPLAY_TIME: Specify when the content should appead on the receivers. Leave blank to send the content as soon as possible.
H_INCLUDE_DL_PLUS: If checked, a DL+ service is included toghether with the dynamic label service (DLS).
DL_MUST_BE_MIN_ONE_CHAR: A dynamic label must be at least one character long
DL_MUST_BE_MAX_128: A dynamic label cannot exceed 128 characters
CLUSTER_SYNC_TOGGLE_HELP:
When this checkbox is enabled the saved data is forwarded to all cluster members, otherwise the request is only processed by this system and no data is synced. 

Note: Only the active system can enable this flag
UNSUPPORTED_CODEC_PARAMS: The selected combination of codec parameters are not supported.
MISSING_CODEPOINT: Unable to encode {{text}} using {{encoding}}. First unsupported character is: {{missingCharacter}}
FAILED_TO_SAVE_LINK_OVERRIDES: Failed to save linkage set overrides
H_DISABLE_IMPLICIT_RDS_LINK: If no RDS IDs are specified, the DAB service ID is implicitly linked against the RDS PI code with the same value. Tick the box to disable this implicit linkage. If one or more RDS IDs are given, then the implicit linkage is automatically disabled.
TOO_MANY_AUDIO_SERVICES: Too many audio services in the contract. Found {{found}}. Allowed in license is: {{max}}
TOO_MANY_DATA_SERVICES: Too many data services in the contract. Found {{found}}. Allowed in license is: {{max}}
TOO_MANY_FHG_CODECS: Too many Fraunhofer AAC codecs in the contract. Found {{found}}. Allowed in license is: {{max}}
TOO_MANY_IRT_MP2_CODECS: Too many IRT MP2 codecs in the contract. Found {{found}}. Allowed in license is: {{max}}
TOO_MANY_CT_MP2_CODECS: Too many Dolby (CT) MP2 codecs in the contract. Found {{found}}. Allowed in license is: {{max}}
LICENSE_ERROR: License error. Too many {{type}} used. Limit is: {{limit}}
CONTRACT_LIMIT_ERROR: Contract limit error. Too many {{type}} used. Limit is: {{limit}}
H_INTERFRAGMENT_DELAY: Add a delay of {{delay_between_each_fragment}} s between each fragment.
LEAVE_BLANK_FOR_DEFAULT: Leave blank for a default name including the mux name, date and time
H_REQUESTED_NUM_FRAMES: The number of ETI frames to record
MAX_RECORDINGS_REACHED: You must delete one or more recordings in order to create a new one
RECORDINGS_NEED_LICENSE: Recording ETI files requires an additional license. Please contact Paneda to learn more.
DUAL_EDI_NOT_SUPPORTED_UPGRADE_NEEDED: Dual independent EDI outputs are not supported on this device. Please contact Paneda to discuss upgrade options if you require this option.
TOO_LOW_DISK_FOR_RECORDING: The system does not have enough free disk space to start the recording.
AGREE_GDPR_COOKIE: By using this site you agree to our GDPR and cookie policies
CLICK_TOGGLE_TIME: Click to toggle between absolute and relative time
H_INPUT_IS_SELECTED_IN_MUX: This input is used in the multiplexer.
H_INPUT_IS_INHIBITED: Input is inhibited and not available for selection.
H_PMD_APP_IS_USED: All PMD applications are combined into the subchannel.
FLYTTA_TEXT_USED_AS_PAD: This text is broadcasted as DLS.
FLYTTA_TEXT_NOT_USED_AS_PAD: This is the embedded metadata of the audio input. It is currently not broadcasted as DLS.
NEED_LICENSE_FOR_MORE_INPUTS: Contact Paneda to obtain an additional license if you require additional inputs for this source.
SERVICE_EXIST_HERE: The FM service exist in this ensemble too
TIME_DELAY_ON: Compensating time delay applied to FM audio signal
TIME_DELAY_OFF: No compensating time delay applied to FM audio signal
ADD_FREQ: Click to add frequency (or press enter)
INVALID_FM_FREQ: Invalid frequency. The frequency must be given in multiples of 100 kHz.
INVALID_DAB_FREQ: Invalid frequency. The frequency must be given in multiples of 16 kHz between 16kHz and 8388.592 MHz.
NOT_BROADCASTED: This field is only to aid in navigating the GUI list. It is not broadcasted
FAILED_TO_SAVE_FREQS: Failed to save the frequency list
SID_HELP: Must be 4 HEX characters for an audio service or 8 HEX characters for a data service.
CA_ID_HELP: 0 = No CA used. 1-7 = used conditional access identifier
SERVICE_CARRIED_IN_THIS_ENSEMBLE: The service is carried in this ensemble
SERVICE_NOT_CARRIED_IN_THIS_ENSEMBLE: The service is not carried in this ensemble
UPDATE_DEVICE_NAME: Update device name (NOTE for remote encoders: this require re-creating the encoder pool and updating all input sources).
OVERRIDE_MUX_TIMESTAMP: Override the timestamp from the mux
H_OVERRIDE_MUX_TIMESTAMP: It is preferred to set the final ATST (TIST) value as late as possible in the system (I.e enable timestamp override)
H_PEER_QUEUE_SYNC: Indicates that the input buffers from all connected peers are synchronized
SET_ERR_FIELD: Set outgoing ERR field to level 1 if event is present in output
SET_ERR_IF_PATCHED: Set outgoing ERR field to level 1 if one or more subchannels are patched
SET_ERR_IF_NON_PREFERRED: Set outgoing ERR field to level 1 if the output is not based on the preferred one
desc_muted: The subchannel is muted. For example during startup or maintenance
desc_no_data: No audio or other data exist in the subchannel
desc_is_file: The content of the subchannel originates from a file rather than a live source
desc_non_preferred_input: The multiplexer has filled the subchannel with content from a non preferred input source
desc_insufficient_history: Data in subchannel is OK right now but lacks sufficient error free history to be considered fully stable
desc_no_pad_data: There are no PAD data in the audio stream. But the service is configured with PAD
desc_old_pad_data: The PAD data is too old. Backup PAD may or may not be used
H_SWITCHBACK_HYSTERESIS: Time in seconds that a failed input must be OK before we switch back to it
CLICK_TOGGLE_ERROR: Click to toggle visibility of {{errorCount}} remarks
H_NEW_ENC_REVISION: Normally, encoders that doesn't change its parameters are kept during a reconfiguration. You may however force a new encoder (application) to be launched if needed. Do so by clicking the button once and then save the source.
STARTED_IN_INTERVAL: Include {{started}} alarms that was started during the selected time period.
ENDED_IN_INTERVAL: Include {{ended}} alarms that was ended during the selected time period (may overlap with started alarms)
ONLY_ACTIVE_IN_INTERVAL: Include {{active}} alarms that was active but did not change state during the selected time period.
TOO_MANY_ITEMS_PLEASE_NARROW_TIME_SELECT: Too many ({{totalItems}}) items selected to view. Plese select a shorter time period above.
INCLUDE_PROVIDERS_IN_HISTORY: Include data from the following providers in the alarm history
INCLUDE_SHARED_ALARMS: Include alarms shared between providers (at least one provider must still be selected)
INCLUDE_CATEGORIES_IN_HISTORY: Include data from the following alarm categories in the alarm history
MAINTENANCE_MODE: Maintenance mode activated - all subchannels muted
H_MAINTENANCE_MODE: Toggle between standard and Maintenance mode. When in maintance mode all subchannels from this system are muted and the switch will not use any data from the system unless no other data exist (in default switch setting)
ADD_BACKUP_FILE_SOURCE: Add a new backup file source
H_BACKUP_FILE_INPUT: The backup file input is automatically used whenever there are no error-free audio inputs. One file input can be used in many services.
FAILED_TO_UPDATE_BACKUP_FILE_SOURCE: Failed to update backup file source
TOO_LONG_DURATION: Too long duration. Found: {{actualDuration}} seconds. Max allowed are {{maxDuration}} seconds.
TOO_LARGE_FILE: Too large file. Found: {{actualSize}} MB. Max allowed are {{maxSize}} MB.
INVALID_FILE_TYPE: Invalid file type. Found: {{actualType}}. Allowed are {{allowedTypes}}.
FILE_UPLOADED_AND_DECODED: File uploaded and decoded into raw PCM
ALARM_NOT_APPLICABLE: This alarm is not applicable for the source type or is filtered out.
H_TOGGLE_RESTART_SERVICE: Click to toggle the disabled state on the restart buttons. Note that restarting services are not normally needed.
FAILED_TO_RESTART_SOME_SERVICE: One or more services failed to restart
H_REBOOT: Click to reboot the operating system
H_TOGGLE_REBOOT: Click to toggle the disable state on the reboot button. Note that rebooting the system is not normally needed.
SELECT_INPUT_2_TYPE: Select input type of stereo channel two
H_PASSPHRASE: The backup file contains sensitive data and is therefore encrypted using a key derived from the user supplied passphrase. Use a passphrase with sufficient randomness and length. Do not use your account password. Leave blank for no passphrase (not recommended). Note that not Paneda nor anyone else can access the file content without the passphrase
Invalid header HMAC: Invalid file signature detected. This indicates that an incorrect passphrase was submitted.
Backup restored: Backup restored. Rebooting automatically in a few seconds...
H_CLUSTER_SECRET: In order for the active and passive system(s) to communicate securely they use a 'secret' known only to the cluster members. In order to verify that all cluster members have the same secret you can compare the fingerprint. To update the secret you must supply a random string of sufficient length (min 16 characters) that will be used as input to derive the new cluster secret. This is typically done only once during installation.
H_TUNNELS: Tunnels are primarily used to provide access to Paneda for remote support and maintenance. The system need access to internet (optionally via a http proxy, see advanced settings) for remote assistance to work. When the tunnels are opened, they are protected by a random password in addition to the normal login credentials needed. this provides an additional security layer.
UPDATE_TRUSTED_ROOT_CA: Update additional trusted root CA store
TRUSTED_ROOT_CA_LONG: Trusted root CA(s). PEM format. May contain several root certificates.
MISSING_LICENSE_CLAIM: Invalid license. Used {{key}} with value {{value}} not present in license
INVALID_JSON: Invalid JSON found. Correct syntax before saving.
H_UPDATE_LANGUAGE_PACKAGE: This will download an updated language pack from https://lang.paneda.tech optionally using the proxy server specified below
FAILED_TO_UPDATE_LANGUAGE_PACK: Failed to update the language pack
SYNC_PFT_SEQ_NO: Synchronize the AF and PFT layer sequence numbers
H_SYNC_PFT_SEQ_NO: This setting will ensure that all PFT fragments sent will use the same AF and PFT sequence number for a specific EDI frame across all EDI ouput flows (with this setting enabled). Not compatible with resend functionality.
H_PFT_SOURCE_AUTO: Automatically pick the source address as determined from the Paneda smart content switch where 0 = preferred source, 1 = second most preferred and so on
H_USE_MNSC: Enable to use MNSC (rfu bit = 0) signalling in EDI. Leave disabled unless MNSC messages are defined.
H_EDI_ENABLE_DISABLE: It is possible to disable an EDI destination by unchecking this tick box and save the changes. It can then easily be enabled again in the future.
PBS_SLS_SIZE_INFO: For the best receiver compatibility and response time, it should be one or more jpg images of 320x240 pixels, each compressed to less than 10 KB.
PBS_SLS_AUTO_CONV_INFO: Images larger than 320x240 will be automatically scaled down to 320x240 , however the automatic compression may not be efficient and the images may end up considerably larger, memory wise, than expected.
H_MANUALLY_SPECIFY_ID: Option to manually specify the ID, otherwise it will be automatically generated.
CLICK_TO_OPEN_FILE_SELECT_DIALOG: Click to open file select dialog
NO_SWITCH_INSTALLED_EXTENDED: The Paneda Smart Content Switch functionality is currently not enabled. If this system is part of a redundancy cluster you should enable the switch below. If this is a standalone system, then consider extending it with a redundant peer.
ENABLE_SWITCH: Enable switch (this action cannot be undone)
REQUIRE_CLUSTER_IN_LICENSE: This feature reuires a license file with a minimum redundant cluster size of two.
TOO_MANY_SWITCH_INPUTS: You cannot add more switch inputs than the max cluster size in the license file.
TOO_MANY_SWITCH_INPUTS_HARDCODED: The switch is limited to max three inputs (from a total of two peers)
SUPPRESS_SEND_IF_MUTED: When the system is muted (maintenance mode/startup), suppress EDI output.
H_SUPPRESS_SEND_IF_MUTED: During maintenance mode and system startup the data is internally marked as 'muted'. You can select to ignore this for the EDI output, or to suppress the sending of EDI data until the data becomes 'unmuted' (recommended).
_H_SELECTED_MUX_DESC: is selected as the base of the output
SHORT_LABEL_HINT_TEXT: Toggle the letters next to the mouse icon
H_USE_DG_CRC: The use of datagroup CRC is mandatory in version 2 of the DAB standard. This setting is only available to support compatibility with legacy transmissions
H_ENCODER_PROFILE_XPAD: Note that the PAD allocation reduces the effective audio bitrate. This may also affect the valid codec combinations
H_MSC_ITEM_SERVICE_ID: Select the service ID of the service that this secondary component should be attached to.
H_MSC_ITEM_SCIDS: Specify the SCIdS of the component or leave blank for auto assignment.
H_MSC_ITEM_INCLUDE_STANDARD_LABEL: When using the extended label it is possible to include a standard label. Refer to your regional profile for recommended usage.
H_MSC_ITEM_TYPE_PRIMARY: Use this variant to create a single primary audio service
H_MSC_ITEM_TYPE_SECONDARY: Use this variant to create a secondary audio service component
H_MSC_ITEM_TYPE_ALIASED: Use this variant to create several audio services/components carrying the same content
H_MSC_ITEM_TYPE_PMD: Use this variant to create a packet mode data subchannel carrying one or more data services/components
H_MSC_ITEM_COUNTRY_OVERRIDE: Normally all services in one multiplexer belong to the same country. When this is not the case you can override the signalled country here.
DRAG_DROP_MSC_ITEM_HERE: Drag and drop MSC Item here
OVERRIDE_ENCODER_PROFILE_TOOLTIP: This MSC item has an encoder profile override
H_REMARK_TAB_INDEXES: Index of the tab holding the application and/or definition that were responsible for generating the remark
H_TOGGLE_HIGHLIGHT_REMARK: Double click to toggle highlighting of items affected by this remark
H_TOGGLE_TAB_REMARK: Double click to navigate to the tab containing the item responsible for generating the remark
HAS_REMARKS: {{remarks}} critical or notice remarks exist for this item
NO_REMARKS: No critical or notice remarks exist for this item
FAILED_TO_UPDATE_MSC_ITEM: Failed to save the MSC item
GUI_EDITING_IS_NOT_IMPLEMENTED_USE_API: GUI editing for {{type}} is not implemented, please use the API
SELECTED_APPLICATION_TYPE_CONTENT_CANNOT: The content for application type {{type}} cannot be viewed in the GUI
ENC_REMARK_unable-to-validate: Unable to validate data against the server
FAILED_TO_UPDATE_ENCODER_PROFILE: Failed to save the encoder profile
AGC_TARGET_TOOLTIP: Set agc power target between -10 and 5 dB in steps of 0.5 dB
CHANNEL_ATTENUATION_TOOLTIP: Set the channel attenuation from 0 to 31.5 dB, disable AGC to enable this field
RF_AMP_CHANNEL_SELECT_TOOLTIP: Select channel to control. (Ensemble 1 or ensemble 2)
FAILED_TO_RETRIEVE_PROXIES: Failed to retrieve proxies from device
ENC_MGMT_AND_API_PORT: Device management and client API port
STOP_FIRST: You must stop the proxy container first before it can be deleted.
FAILED_TO_DELETE_PROXY_CONTAINER: Failed to remove the proxy container
ONE_PROXY_PORT_DESC: {{unitSource}} connects to port {{targetPort}} {{targetPortLabel}} on {{unitTarget}} IP {{targetIp}} {{targetIpLabel}} via proxy port {{targetProxyPort}} {{targetProxyPortLabel}} and IP {{proxyIp}} {{proxyIpLabel}}
ONE_PROXY_ALLOWED_DESC: Traffic is allowed only from source IP: {{srcIp}} {{srcIpLabel}}
SUCCESS_CREATE_PROXY_CONTAINER: Successfully created a new proxy container. Do not forget to start it.
FAILED_TO_CREATE_PROXY_CONTAINER: Failed to create new proxy container
CLICK_TEXT_MODE: Click to switch to text mode
CLICK_LIST_MODE: Click to switch to list mode
FILL_OUT_PROXY_INFO: Populate the create new proxy container form with the settings used to create this proxy container
ADD_WHITELIST_IP_FOR_API_ACCESS: Add a whitelisted IP address for API access
H_PBS_STATUS_AUDIO_PARAMS_SYNC: Indicates that external audio headers can be decoded
PBS_SLS_TIME_TO_TRANSMIT_INFO: The approximate transmission time is the maximum time it will take to transmit the image over the air. The actual time until the image is displayed on the receiver may differ as it depends greatly on the implementation of the receiver.
H_EDIT_SERVICE_ADVANCED: Click to toggle edit of configuration file in advanced mode. Note that this is normally not needed.
H_ADVANCED_MODE_EDIT_WARNING: Warning: Editing this file in advanced mode can severely impact the functionality of the system. Only do so if instructed by Paneda support personnel.
ORIGINAL_VALUE: This control has pending (unsaved) changes. Original (saved) value is
READ_ONLY_IN_DOCKER: Read-only when system is deployed in docker
H_ENABLE_DELETE_ALARM_HISTORY: Enable the delete button for the alarm history
H_DELETE_ALARM_HISTORY: Delete the alarm history. Any unresolved alarms are unaffected. This action cannot be undone.
H_EXPORT_HISTORY: Export alarm history as comma separated values (.csv)
H_EPG_PROFILE_ID_LIST: The list of SPI Profile IDs that is carried within this service. See ETSI TS 102 371 section 7.1.1
H_SPI_SOURCE_HAS_NO_DATA: The selected SPI source does not have any carousel data.
H_SPI_SOURCE_HAS_ERROR: The selected SPI source has an error in its carousel data.
MAX_16_ALPHA_NUM_CHARS_VALIDATION: Maximum 16 lower case characters in the range [a-z] [0-9]
H_INCLUDE_DEFAULT_ADDITIONAL_MOT_PARAMET: Setting the correct MOT parameters for each object can be cumbersome and requires a deep knowledge of the MOT standard as well. The system can therefore automatically set some of the optional MOT parameters to sensible defaults without having to specify each parameter and its value individually.
H_EMPTY_CONFIG: A predefined, read-only and empty configuration
H_ON_AIR_CONFIG: The configuration that is currently being broadcasted. Currently from: '{{createdFrom}}'
H_GAIN: Adjust the gain of the signal. Expressed in dB. For example +6dB means a doubling of the signal.
H_CLEAR_STATS: Clear all counters. This will allow you to see changes from now on only. Cannot be undone.
H_FIG_LEGEND_EXPAND: Click to toggle view of all individual FIGs.
H_FIG_LEGEND_ACTIVE: Active FIG. I.e. was recently seen in relation to its average repetition rate.
H_FIG_LEGEND_INACTIVE: Inactive FIG. I.e. no longer present in the FIC, but are kept in the view for 10 additional minutes.
H_FIG_LEGEND_UNKNOWN: Pending FIG. I.e. has only been seen once, and thus no repetition rate exist yet.
PBS_BREAK_IN_TOOLTIP: Toggle break-in using the selected audio file.
PBS_USE_CHECKBOX_TO_OVERRIDE_SIGNAL: Use checkbox to override signal state
msc_item_remark_unable-to-validate: Unable to validate data against the server
msc_layout_remark_duplicated-subchannel-: Duplicated subchannel ID found in layout
msc_layout_remark_duplicated-service-id: Duplicated service ID found in layout
msc_layout_remark_duplicated-msc-item-re: Duplicated MSC item found in layout
msc_layout_remark_scids-auto-manual-mixe: Mixed SCIdS auto and manual assignment within a service
msc_layout_remark_remark-in-reference: Referenced MSC item or encoder profile has remarks
msc_layout_remark_unable-to-validate: Unable to validate data against the server
